title: Orange Granita
ingredients: 4 tablespoons of orange-favored liqueur (such as Grand Marnier)
instructions: In a saucepan combine the water, sugar, 2 tablespoons of orange liqueur, and orange rind and bring the water to a boil over moderate heat, stirring until the sugar is dissolved.  Simmer the syrup for 5 minutes and let it cool.  Remove the orange rind.

In a large bowl combine the orange juice, 2 tablespoons of orange liqueur, and the syrup and stir the mixture until it’s well combined.  Pour this mixture into a freezer tray and freeze it until it is firm but not frozen hard.  Transfer the mixture to a bowl and beat it smooth.  Again transfer the mixture back to the freezer trays and to the freezer.  Freeze the mixture for 3 hours more, or until it is firm.
Take from the freezer and let the freezer tray stand at room temperature for 5 minutes, or until it is just soft enough to scoop.
Remarks:  You may wish to use food coloring to enhance the granita’s color.
Source:  Gastronomie Sans Argent, Granitas, Gourmet Magazine, September 1978.
